title: How would you rate my singing and backing track? - Quora

response.answer_text: I really liked it! I think you have really good vocal tone and an overall nice voice, it’s really pleasant to listen to and I really enjoyed it. The only things I would improve on are that it seems like a few times you tried to do a run but you let it float, instead of defining it. Which is fine, but usually runs have more of a point on them so you can tell it’s a run, kind of like what Beyoncé does in her song; “If I Were A Boy” when she sings “bOyYyY-HeE”. If you don’t sharpen your runs it makes it sound like you’ve lost your breath. (1:13–1:17) Just make sure you define the notes more and stabilize them better. The backdrop was also really nice and calming, but I felt like it never left the chorus or changed, or if it did I didn’t really notice it. Other than that the song overall was really pleasant and I wouldn’t mind hearing more songs like that.

I listened to it, do you have an uncompressed version? I’d like to be able to get a better handle on your vocals from a technical point of view. With close mic work & signing into your ‘vocal fry’ it’s difficult to assess breathing & pitch control. If you have a .WAV file? I’d like to hear it. based on this though, the mix is a bit heavy on the vocal side; and sounds separated. I’d like to hear you sing with projection rather than close into the mic. It’s not doing you any favors.
